title: Zoodles, Crispy Prosciutto, and Roasted Cauliflower with Lemon Parmesan Sauce
directions: Preheat oven to 450. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and set aside. /p Toss cauliflower with 1 tbsp olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Lay on prepared baking tray and roast for 20 minutes until easily pierced with a fork and lightly browned. /p While cauliflower is roasting, combine all ingredients for the lemon dressing (lemon zest and juice, Greek Yogurt, grated parmesan, salt and pepper) and set aside. /p Mince the garlic and shallot. Spiralize the zucchini (blade C on a spiralizer) and trim noodles. /p Place a large skillet over medium heat and coat with cooking spray. Lay in the prosciutto slices and cook for 3-5 minutes or until crispy. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate and set aside. /p Allow the skillet to cool before adding remaining 1 tbsp olive oil and heating over medium heat. Add garlic, shallots, and red pepper flakes. Cook 30 seconds or until fragrant, and then add zucchini noodles. Cook 3-5 minutes. /p Add in cauliflower and crumble prosciutto over the skillet. Give a toss, then remove from the heat and stir in the Lemon Dressing. Toss to combine and divide into bowls. Sprinkle with parsley to garnish. /p Serving Size: ½ of total yield /p Calories 257
